result.execSummary:
The defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.
  • Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
COUNTS 1 & 2: Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
 AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, if not already done.

Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 6 years initial confinement in this case.
Concurrent with: **7/21/2015  amended to state counts one and two are concurrent with each other; and consecutive to any other sentence including 10CF006086.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.
Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.

No illegal drugs.
No controlled substances without valid prescription.
No contact with drug community.
No Contact with Jenna B., Neil R., Tri City Bank and Associated Bank.

Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
Absolute sobriety.
Random urine screens.  No positive results.

Cognitive Behavior Therapy.
Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.

supervisions.notes: Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by DOC, but to  include: those as listed.
Concurrent with: *7/21/2015 AS STATED IN COUNT ONE.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Craig Dwayne Surdyk

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (34 pages) commencing JULY 8, 2015 received and filed. kl

Per Order signed on July 21, 2015:  JOC shall be amended to state that counts one and two are concurent with each other, and consecutive to any other sentence including 10CF006086.
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence in file states also "defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program", now also entered on JOC.
Order Amending Judgment of Conviction filed and signed by the Court.  Copies to the parties.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William S. Pocan, Br. 26, for review. mag
DOC request to clarify JOC.
dated June 1, 2015, filed.

Defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.  

AS TO CONCURRENT COUNTS 1 & 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 12 years, consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 7 years with credit for 0 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 5 years.

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:
 *
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Absolute sobriety.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No controlled substances without valid prescription.
*No contact with drug community.
*No Contact with Jenna B., Neil R., Tri City Bank and Associated Bank.
*Seek and maintain full time employment.
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy.

- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
-- AS TO COUNT 1 ONLY: Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the mandatory DNA surcharge, if not already done.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, out of up to 25% prison funds, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program after serving 6 years initial confinement in this case.

- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case calendared for sentencing hearing.  Court in trial.  Defense counsel requests new sentencing date.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Letter from defendant filed.

Defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk in custody.  Lucy Kronforst and Tyrone St. Junior II appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

AS TO BOTH COUNTS:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms and body armour warning given.  Voting admonishment given. DNA notification given.  PSI not ordered.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 26.

Court advised parties restitution will be addressed at sentencing.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp  Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for 06-01-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk not in court, in custody.  Tyrone Martin St. Junior appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-29-2015 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed with court.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with ANY Associated Bank or Tri City Bank

Defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk in court with attorney Lisa M. Procaccio.  Defendant Craig Dwayne Surdyk in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
